text:
Online debate sparked after ute tailgates on Gold Coast highway By nine.com.au staff 
A 4WD ute has sat so close on the tail of a sedan on a Gold Coast highway there is barely visible daylight between the vehicles. 
Video of the incident was filmed on the M1 heading southbound near Ormeau, and was posted to Dash Cam Owners Australia on Saturday. 
Both vehicles can be seen speeding past in the right hand lane, with the red ute so close it almost looks as if it is getting towed. 
Despite multiple clear lanes to the left of the vehicles, both drivers surge ahead with hardly a gap between them. 
The video has clocked up more than 141,000 views and 1,500 comments, many of which fiercely debate who is in the wrong. 
"If I had a dollar every time I got stuck behind someone on the M1 sitting in the right hand line I could afford to buy a helicopter to fly everywhere and avoid the right lane hogging idiot," one user said. 
The most liked comment was "idiot, but stop holding everyone up by sitting in the right overtaking lane!" 
Despite the infuriating nature of right hand lane drivers, the Queensland road rules find tailgating to be the much more dangerous offence. 
Failing to keep left in the sunshine state on a multi-lane road is a $73 fine and two demerit points. 
But following too closely to the vehicle in front is a much heftier $284 fine and one demerit point.
